a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = 20"
and h1 : "tan (x * pi / 180) + 4 * sin (x * pi / 180) = sqrt 3"
shows  "sqrt 3 = tan (x * pi / 180) + 4 * sin (x * pi / 180)"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute $\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ.$ The final Answer is \sqrt{3}
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} + 4 \sin 20^\circ \\ &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}. \end{align}By double angle formula, \[\frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}.\]Then by sum-to-product, \begin{align}
 \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ + \sin 40^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\ &= \frac{2 \sin 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\
 &= \frac{\cos 10^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\ &= \frac{\cos 10^\circ + \cos 50^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}. \end{align}Again by sum-to-product, \[\frac{\cos 10^\circ + \cos 50^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{2 \cos 30^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = 2 \cos 30^\circ = \boxed{\sqrt{3}}.\]
 *)

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = 20"
and h1 : "x * pi / 180 = radians"
and h2 : "tan radians + 4 * sin radians = sqrt 3"
shows  "sqrt 3 = tan (x * pi / 180) + 4 * sin (x * pi / 180)"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute $\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ.$ The final Answer is \sqrt{3}
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} + 4 \sin 20^\circ \\ &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}. \end{align}By double angle formula, \[\frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}.\]Then by sum-to-product, \begin{align}
 \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ + \sin 40^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\ &= \frac{2 \sin 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\
 &= \frac{\cos 10^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\ &= \frac{\cos 10^\circ + \cos 50^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}. \end{align}Again by sum-to-product, \[\frac{\cos 10^\circ + \cos 50^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{2 \cos 30^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = 2 \cos 30^\circ = \boxed{\sqrt{3}}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = 20"
and h1 : "x * pi / 180 = radians"
and h2 : "tan radians + 4 * sin radians = sqrt 3"
shows  "sqrt 3 = tan (x * pi / 180) + 4 * sin (x * pi / 180)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
